reference.unstructured: Baldwin, Richard E. "A Domino Theory of Regionalism," in R. E. Baldwin, P. Haaparanta, and J. Kiander, eds., Expanding Membership in the European Union (Cambridge, UK: Cambridge University Press, 1995), pp. 25- 48.
Bhagwati, Jagdish, "Regionalism and Multilateralism: An Overview," in De Melo and Panagariya (1993).

Bhagwati, Jagdish, and Arvind Panagariya, "Preferential Trading Areas and Multilateralism-Strangers, Friends, or Foes?" in The Economics of Preferential Trade Agreements, Jagdish Bhagwati and Arvind Panagariya, eds. (Washington, DC: The AEI Press, 1996).

Brown, Drusilla K. "The Impact of a North American Free Trade Area: Applied General Equilibrium Models," in North American Free Trade: Assessing the Impact, Nora Lustig, Barry P. Bosworth, and Robert Z. Lawrence, eds. (Washington, DC: The Brookings Institution, 1992).

Chang, Won, and L. Alan Winters, "How Regional Blocs Affect Excluded Countries: The Price Effects of MERCOSUR," Discussion Paper No. 2179 (June), Centre for Economic Policy Research, London, 1999, American Economic Review, forthcoming.
De la Torre, Augusto, and Margaret R. Kelly, Regional Trade Arrangements, International Monetary Fund Occasional Paper 93 (Washington, DC: International Monetary Fund, March 1992).

Deardorff, Alan V., and Robert M. Stern, "Multilateral Trade Negotiations and Preferential Trading Arrangements," in Analytical and Negotiating Issues in the Global Trading System, Alan V. Deardorff and Robert M. Stern, eds. (Ann Arbor, MI: University of Michigan Press, 1994).
De Melo, Jaime, and Arvind Panagariya, eds., New Dimensions in Regional Integration (Cambridge, UK: Cambridge University Press, 1993).

Dixit, Avinash K. "Strategic Aspects of Trade Policy," in Advances in Economic Theory: Papers Presented at the Fifth World Congress of the Econometric Society, Truman Bewley, ed. (Cambridge, UK: Cambridge University Press, 1987).
Dixit, Avinash K., and Victor Norman, Theory of International Trade (Cambridge, UK: Cambridge University Press, 1980).
Eichengreen, Barry, and Douglas Irwin, "The Role of History in Trade Flows," in The Regionalization of the World Economy, Jeffrey A. Frankel, ed. (Chicago, IL: University of Chicago Press, 1998).

Frankel, Jeffrey A., Ernesto Stein, and Shang-Jin Wei, "Continental Trading Blocks: Are They Natural or Supernatural?" in The Regionalization of the World Economy, Jeffrey Frankel, ed. (Chicago, IL: University of Chicago Press, 1998).

Frankel, Jeffrey A., and Shang-Jin Wei, "Regionalization of World Trade and Currencies: Economics and Politics," in The Regionalization of the World Economy, Jeffrey Frankel, ed. (Chicago, IL: University of Chicago Press, 1998).

Freund, Caroline, and John McLaren, "On the Dynamics of Trade Diversion: Evidence from Four Trade Blocks," Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System, International Finance Discussion Paper No. 637, June 1999.

Krugman, Paul, "Is Bilateralism Bad?" in International Trade and Trade Policy, Elhanan Helpman and Assaf Razin, eds. (Cambridge, MA: MIT Press, 1991).
Muirhead, B. W., The Development of Postwar Canadian Trade Policy: The Failure of the Anglo-European Option (Montreal, Canada: McGill-Queens Press, 1992).

Rodrik, Dani, "The Rush to Free Trade in the Developing World: Why So Late? Why Now? Will It Last?" in Voting for Reform: Democracy, Political Liberalization, and Economic Adjustment, Stephan Haggard and Steven B. Webb, eds. (New York, NY: Oxford University Press, 1994).

Staiger, Robert W. "A Theory of Gradual Trade Liberalization," in New Directions in Trade Theory, Jim Levinsohn, Alan V. Deardorff, and Robert M. Stern, eds. (Ann Arbor, MI: The University of Michigan Press, 1995).

Tsalicoglou, Iacovos S., Negotiating for Entry: The Accession of Greece to the European Community (Aldershot, UK: Dartmouth Publishing Co., 1995).
Tsoukalis, Loukas, The New European Economy: The Politics and Economics of Integration (Oxford, UK: Oxford University Press, 1993).
Viner, Jacob, The Customs Union Issue (New York, NY: Carnegie Endowment for International Peace, 1950).
Winham, Gilbert R. "Why Canada Acted," in Bilateralism, Multilateralism and Canada in U. S. Trade Policy, William Diebold, Jr., ed. (Cambridge, MA: Ballinger, 1988).
